title:
Direct writing of lead zirconate titanate piezoelectric structures by
electrohydrodynamic atomisation.
abstract:
Direct writing, consisting of the directed deposition of individual droplets of
ceramic suspension using ink jet printing can be used to produce piezoelectric
structures with feature sizes in excess of 100 μm. This work presents an
alternative direct writing technique, consisting of directed individual droplets
produced by electrohydrodynamic atomisation (EHDA), where feature sizes an order
of magnitude smaller can be achieved. This technique opens up the possibility of
using direct writing technology to produce integrated MEMS devices. Low toxicity
lead zirconate titantate (PZT) sol has been used in conjunction with the EHDA
process to produce isolated features and lines with dimensions as small as 20
μm. These features, when fired, form the perovskite PZT crystal structure. Using
an X–Y stage to move the sample, it is possible to create a variety of struct
